document_data.name: Body Shop
document_data.mainbody: The '''Body Shop''' was a store belonging to the [[Datharathi]] [[chaka]] in [[Vaelan]], [[Durpar]]. They grafted customers with [[plangent crystal]] [[prosthetics]], turning them into [[plangent]]s.{{cite book/Darkvision|107-112|11}}
document_data.Location: The Body Shop was visible from far away even in the bustle of Vaelan, thanks to the statue atop it.
document_data.Structure:
Atop the building a smoothly flowing, slender humanoid statue made of both gray stone and [[rose quartz]] reached for the sky. The statue was about {{SI|75|feet|long=yes}} tall.

The lobby was longer than it was wide, made of flowing lines, with six displays: three on each lateral wall, advertising [[plangent]] configurations for sale: there was nothing else visible save for a white door.
document_data.Services: For those with the money, any plangent configuration could be provided.
document_data.History: [[Warian Datharathi]], who left the city after {{yearlink|1367}}, learned in {{yearlink|1374}} that plangents had become common in Vaelan during his absence.{{cite book/Darkvision|63-64|7}} It was popular knowledge that one could become a plangent at the Body Shop, suggesting that th Body Shop had been founded sometime after 1367 DR.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Per [[Eined Datharathi]], those who took the crystal into their own bodies were no longer themselves.{{cite book/Darkvision|114|11}}
